name: Philosophy
description: Study of fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

topics.name: Ontology
topics.content: Study of being and existence.
topics.theory: Ontology explores categories of existence.
topics.practical: Influences fields like AI and knowledge representation.
topics.facts: One core debate is whether universals exist.
assessments: Explain the difference between ontology and metaphysics.

topics.name: Cosmology
topics.content: Study of the origin and structure of the universe.
topics.theory: Philosophical cosmology includes arguments about the universe's existence.
topics.practical: Impacts how we understand time and space.
topics.facts: Ancient cosmology was often mythologically based.
assessments: Discuss differences between philosophical and physical cosmology.

topics.name: Theory of Knowledge
topics.content: Study of knowledge and justified belief.
topics.theory: Covers definitions of knowledge, such as justified true belief.
topics.practical: Applies to education and scientific methodology.
topics.facts: Gettier problems challenge classical theories of knowledge.

topics.name: Utilitarianism
topics.content: Ethical theory that actions are right if they benefit the majority.
topics.theory: Associated with philosophers like Bentham and Mill.
topics.practical: Used in policy and cost-benefit analysis.
topics.facts: Utilitarianism faces criticism for ignoring minority rights.

name: Mathematics
description: Science of numbers, quantities, shapes, and abstract structures.

topics.name: Linear Algebra
topics.content: Branch of mathematics concerning linear equations and vectors.
topics.theory: Covers vector spaces, linear transformations, and matrices.
topics.practical: Used in computer graphics, machine learning, and engineering.
topics.facts: Many algorithms rely on solving linear equations.
assessments: Solve a system of linear equations.

topics.name: Abstract Algebra
topics.content: Study of algebraic structures like groups and rings.
topics.theory: Focuses on properties of mathematical structures.
topics.practical: Applications in cryptography and coding theory.
topics.facts: Group theory underpins symmetry in physics.
assessments: Give an example of a ring.

topics.name: Differential Calculus
topics.content: Study of rates of change and slopes of curves.
topics.theory: Based on limits, derivatives, and continuity.
topics.practical: Used in physics for motion, in engineering, and optimization.
topics.facts: Isaac Newton and Leibniz independently developed calculus.
assessments: Explain the concept of a limit.

topics.name: Euclidean Geometry
topics.content: Study of plane and solid figures based on axioms.
topics.theory: Based on Euclid's postulates, including the parallel postulate.
topics.practical: Used in architecture, engineering, and computer graphics.
topics.facts: Non-Euclidean geometries arise when the parallel postulate is altered.

name: Physical Science
description: Study of non-living systems, including physics and chemistry.

topics.name: Classical Mechanics
topics.content: Branch of physics dealing with motion of bodies under forces.
topics.theory: Based on Newton's laws of motion and gravitation.
topics.practical: Used in engineering, biomechanics, and astronomy.
topics.facts: Newton formulated laws from which many phenomena can be predicted.

topics.name: Organic Chemistry
topics.content: Study of carbon-containing compounds.
topics.theory: Covers structure, properties, and reactions of organic molecules.
topics.practical: Essential for pharmaceuticals, plastics, and petrochemicals.
topics.facts: Thousands of organic reactions are known and categorized.

topics.name: Stellar Astronomy
topics.content: Study of stars, their formation and evolution.
topics.theory: Includes nuclear fusion processes and life cycles of stars.
topics.practical: Helps us understand galaxies and cosmology.
topics.facts: The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star.

name: Biology
description: Study of living organisms and life processes.

topics.name: Cell Structure
topics.content: Study of cell components like nucleus, mitochondria.
topics.theory: Cells have organelles that perform specific functions.
topics.practical: Understanding cells leads to advances in medicine.
topics.facts: The human body contains trillions of cells.

topics.name: DNA Structure
topics.content: Study of the molecular structure of DNA.
topics.theory: DNA is a double helix composed of nucleotides.
topics.practical: Key to genetic engineering and understanding heredity.
topics.facts: DNA sequencing was first completed in 1953.

topics.name: Natural Selection
topics.content: Mechanism by which traits become more or less common.
topics.theory: Proposed by Darwin, variation and survival of the fittest drive evolution.
topics.practical: Explains biodiversity and guides conservation efforts.
topics.facts: Natural selection can lead to speciation.

name: Medical Science
description: Study of health, disease, and medical practice.

topics.name: Human Cardiovascular System
topics.content: Study of the heart and blood vessels.
topics.theory: Heart pumps blood through circulation loops.
topics.practical: Critical in understanding heart diseases.
topics.facts: The heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
assessments: Explain blood flow through the heart.

topics.name: Nervous System
topics.content: Study of the neural mechanisms in organisms.
topics.theory: Includes brain, spinal cord, and nerves that transmit signals.
topics.practical: Foundational to neurology and psychiatry.
topics.facts: Nerve impulses travel at varying speeds.

topics.name: Drug Mechanisms
topics.content: Study of how drugs interact with biological systems.
topics.theory: Includes pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics.
topics.practical: Used in developing medications and treatments.
topics.facts: Many drugs act as agonists or antagonists at receptors.

name: Engineering
description: Application of science and math to design and build structures and systems.

topics.name: Circuit Analysis
topics.content: Study of how electric circuits operate.
topics.theory: Uses Ohm's and Kirchhoff's laws to analyze circuits.
topics.practical: Design of all electronic devices relies on circuit analysis.
topics.facts: Simple circuits consist of resistors, capacitors, and inductors.

topics.name: Thermodynamics
topics.content: Study of energy, heat, and work.
topics.theory: Involves laws of thermodynamics and energy transfer.
topics.practical: Applied in engine design, HVAC systems, and more.
topics.facts: The second law dictates energy flows from hot to cold spontaneously.
assessments: Explain the first law of thermodynamics.
Perform a heat engine efficiency calculation.

topics.name: Structural Analysis
topics.content: Study of forces and stresses on structures.
topics.theory: Uses mechanics of materials and static equilibrium equations.
topics.practical: Vital for building safe bridges and buildings.
topics.facts: Structures must account for live and dead loads.

name: Computer Science
description: Study of computation, algorithms, and information processing.

topics.name: Sorting Algorithms
topics.content: Methods for ordering elements in a list.
topics.theory: Includes algorithms like quicksort, mergesort, and bubble sort.
topics.practical: Crucial for data processing and efficiency.
topics.facts: Quicksort has average-case O(n log n) complexity.

topics.name: Binary Trees
topics.content: Hierarchical data structure with nodes.
topics.theory: Each node has at most two children.
topics.practical: Used in databases, search algorithms, and file systems.
topics.facts: Binary search trees allow fast lookup operations.

topics.name: Machine Learning
topics.content: Study of algorithms that improve with data.
topics.theory: Includes supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
topics.practical: Used in speech recognition, recommendation systems, and more.
topics.facts: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning using neural networks.

name: Social Science
description: Study of societies and social relationships.

topics.name: Cognitive Psychology
topics.content: Study of mental processes like memory and perception.
topics.theory: Explores how people think and process information.
topics.practical: Applied in therapy, education, and UX design.
topics.facts: Memory can be divided into short-term and long-term storage.

topics.name: Social Stratification
topics.content: Study of social hierarchy and inequality.
topics.theory: Examines class, caste, race, and gender divisions.
topics.practical: Helps in policy-making and understanding societies.
topics.facts: Systems of stratification vary widely across cultures.

topics.name: Microeconomics
topics.content: Study of individuals and businesses in the economy.
topics.theory: Includes supply and demand, market structures, and consumer behavior.
topics.practical: Used in business decisions and policy.
topics.facts: Adam Smith's 'invisible hand' concept comes from economics.

name: Humanity
description: Study of human culture, history, and society.

topics.name: Egyptian Civilization
topics.content: Study of ancient Egypt's history and culture.
topics.theory: Encompasses pharaohs, pyramids, and hieroglyphics.
topics.practical: Understanding the roots of modern civilization.
topics.facts: Egyptian pyramids were built as tombs for pharaohs.

topics.name: World War II
topics.content: Study of global war from 1939 to 1945.
topics.theory: Covers causes, major events, and outcomes of the war.
topics.practical: Teaches lessons on conflict and geopolitics.
topics.facts: Over 70 million people died in WWII.

topics.name: Shakespearean Plays
topics.content: Study of plays written by William Shakespeare.
topics.theory: Examines themes, characters, and historical context.
topics.practical: Important for understanding English literature and language.
topics.facts: Shakespeare invented many English words and phrases.
assessments: Discuss common themes in Shakespeare plays.

topics.name: Logic
topics.content: Study of reasoning and argument structure.
topics.theory: Includes deductive and inductive reasoning, logical fallacies.
topics.practical: Enhances critical thinking and debate skills.
topics.facts: Aristotle is often called the father of logic.

name: Arts
description: Creative expression through visual, auditory, or performative forms.

topics.name: Impressionism
topics.content: Art movement emphasizing light and color.
topics.theory: Artists painted en plein air capturing light effects.
topics.practical: Influences modern art and visual design.
topics.facts: Claude Monet was a famous Impressionist.
assessments: Explain the significance of light in Impressionism.

topics.name: Classical Music
topics.content: Art music rooted in traditions of Western culture.
topics.theory: Includes harmony, melody, and structured compositions.
topics.practical: Performed in orchestras and concerts.
topics.facts: Beethoven and Mozart are key figures in classical music.

topics.name: Film Noir
topics.content: Genre of dark, stylistic Hollywood crime films.
topics.theory: Features themes of moral ambiguity and use of shadow.
topics.practical: Influences modern cinematography and storytelling.
topics.facts: Popular in the 1940s and 50s in the USA.
assessments: Give examples of film noir movies.

name: Economics
description: Study of production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.

topics.name: Inflation
topics.content: General increase in prices and fall in currency value.
topics.theory: Caused by demand-pull or cost-push factors.
topics.practical: Central banks manage inflation through interest rates.
topics.facts: Hyperinflation can destabilize economies.

topics.name: Market Structures
topics.content: Different types of market organization.
topics.theory: Includes perfect competition, monopoly, and oligopoly.
topics.practical: Affects pricing and consumer choice.
topics.facts: Monopolies are regulated to prevent abuse.

topics.name: Trade Theory
topics.content: Study of trade between countries.
topics.theory: Includes concepts like comparative advantage.
topics.practical: Guides trade policy and agreements.
topics.facts: Trade can increase global welfare.

name: Law
description: System of rules and guidelines governing society.

topics.name: Felonies vs Misdemeanors
topics.content: Classification of crimes by severity.
topics.theory: Felonies are serious crimes; misdemeanors are less severe.
topics.practical: Affects sentencing and legal proceedings.
topics.facts: Penalties differ significantly between felonies and misdemeanors.

topics.name: Elements of a Contract
topics.content: Requirements for a legally binding contract.
topics.theory: Includes offer, acceptance, consideration, capacity, and legality.
topics.practical: Important in business and personal agreements.
topics.facts: Verbal contracts can be binding but are harder to prove.

topics.name: Patent Law
topics.content: Legal rights for inventions and processes.
topics.theory: Patents grant exclusive rights for a limited time.
topics.practical: Encourages innovation by protecting inventors.
topics.facts: Patents typically last 20 years from filing.

name: Environment
description: Study of interactions between the physical, chemical, and biological components of the environment.

topics.name: Ecosystems
topics.content: Communities of organisms interacting with their environment.
topics.theory: Includes concepts of food chains, niches, and habitats.
topics.practical: Important for conservation and resource management.
topics.facts: Ecosystems can range from small ponds to entire forests.

topics.name: Global Warming
topics.content: Long-term rise in Earth's average temperature.
topics.theory: Caused by greenhouse gas emissions from human activity.
topics.practical: Leads to policy changes and renewable energy adoption.
topics.facts: Recent years have been the warmest on record.

topics.name: Biodiversity
topics.content: Variety of life in an ecosystem.
topics.theory: Higher biodiversity usually means more resilient ecosystems.
topics.practical: Conservation efforts focus on protecting species diversity.
topics.facts: Hotspots of biodiversity exist in tropical rainforests.

name: Aerospace
description: Field of technology and industry related to aviation and space flight.

topics.name: Flight Mechanics
topics.content: Study of forces and motion in air travel.
topics.theory: Involves aerodynamics, lift, drag, and stability.
topics.practical: Design of aircraft wings and controls.
topics.facts: Wright brothers made the first powered flight in 1903.

topics.name: Orbital Mechanics
topics.content: Study of how objects move in space under gravity.
topics.theory: Based on Newtonian mechanics and Kepler's laws.
topics.practical: Used for satellite launches and interplanetary travel.
topics.facts: Satellites stay in orbit by balancing gravity and inertia.

topics.name: Propulsion Systems
topics.content: Technology that moves spacecraft.
topics.theory: Includes rocket engines, ion thrusters, and chemical propellants.
topics.practical: Essential for satellites, probes, and crewed spacecraft.
topics.facts: Rocket equation relates fuel mass to velocity change.
